intro: Rhododendron boninense, commonly known as the Bonin rhododendron, is a species native to the Bonin Islands. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows in coastal and forested areas. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
